qas.question: What is involved in remedy discovery?

context: <a5_0>Drug discovery<a5_0/> is <a0_0><b9_0>the process by which potential drugs are discovered or designed<b9_0/><a0_0/>. In the past most drugs have been discovered either by <a3_0><b12_0>isolating the <a8_0>active ingredient<a8_0/> from traditional remedies or by serendipitous discovery<b12_0/><a3_0/>. Modern <a4_0><a7_0><b13_0>biotechnology<b13_0/><a7_0/><a4_0/> often focuses on understanding the metabolic pathways related to a disease state or pathogen, and manipulating these pathways using <a2_0><b11_0>molecular biology or biochemistry<b11_0/><a2_0/>. A great deal of early-stage drug discovery has traditionally been carried out by <a1_0><b10_0>universities and <a6_0>research institutions<b10_0/><a6_0/><a1_0/>.
